thread.title: Liverpool stars enjoy night out after Tottenham victory
thread.title_full: Liverpool stars enjoy night out after Tottenham victory | Daily Mail Online

author: Andy Warren For Mailonline
title: Liverpool stars enjoy night out after Tottenham victory
text:
Liverpool's players have clearly been enjoying that winning feeling after getting back on track against Tottenham on Saturday.
The Reds had not won in the Premier League in 2017, heading into Saturday's clash with Spurs, but two Sadio Mane goals ensured they got a positive response in front of their home fans at Anfield.
The day after the game, Liverpool's Brazilian trio of Philippe Coutinho, Roberto Firmino and Lucas Leiva were joined by Spanish full back Alberto Moreno, with the quartet enjoying an evening out in celebration.
Scroll down for video
Alberto Moreno, Philippe Coutinho, Roberto Firmino and Lucas Leiva with Wesley Safadao
Firmino took to Instagram to revel in the moment alongside his wife Larissa Pereira
Firmino shared a video of Safadao singing, while Coutinho posted a picture with his wife
They were pictured alongside Brazilian singer-songwriter Wesley Safadao after attending his concert in London, with Firmino posting an image of the four Liverpool players with the star.
Safadao is a star of a range of genres in his homeland, having began his career at the age of 15, and was due to perform a show at the O2 Forum in Kentish Town, London, on Sunday night.
Firmino also shared a video of the duo singing together, with the caption translated as 'ooh, the explosion' after one of Safadao's songs.
Coutinho also took to Instagram to post a clip of the players enjoying some music on Saturday night, with all four standing in a line and dancing to the Latin beat and singing along.
Philippe Coutinho posted this image of himself and wife Aine alongside the Brazilian singer
Coutinho posted an image of the four Liverpool players enjoying Safadao's music
The star midfielder also shared an image of he and wife Aine alongside the singer.
Liverpool's win on Saturday night leaves them fourth in the table, but they could lose their place in the Champions League qualification places if Manchester City pick up points against Bournemouth on Monday night.
Their disastrous January saw them slip out of the top four and exit both cup competitions as they lost to Southampton in the EFL Cup and exited the FA Cup at the hands of Wolves.
Jurgen Klopp's side now have a two-week break from action before playing champions Leicester on February 27 - which will come 16 days after their win over Tottenham.
Lucas Leiva shared this image of himself alongside Safadao and his partner, Ariana
Moreno and his girlfriend Lilia Granadilla was happy to have a photo too with the singer
